faq.title: Frequently asked
faq.description: Quickly find answers to your questions
faq.q1: How do I become a Hopefund Burundi member?
faq.a1: To become a member, visit one of our branches with your Burundian ID card and a passport photo. You will need to pay a minimum share of 10,000 BIF. You can also pre-register via our mobile app or by dialing *847#.
faq.q2: What documents are needed for a loan?
faq.a2: For a loan application, you will need: your ID card, proof of residence (residence certificate), and depending on the loan type, a business plan or proof of income. For Ibimina groups, the group's solidarity guarantee may suffice.
faq.q3: Is Hopefund Burundi really a Christian institution?
faq.a3: Yes, Hopefund Burundi was founded on Christian principles of mutual aid and solidarity. Our values of transparency, integrity and love of neighbor guide all our actions. We are open to all, regardless of faith, and we respect the diversity of our members.
faq.q4: How does an Ibimina group work?
faq.a4: An Ibimina group brings together 10 to 30 people who save together. Each member contributes regularly, and the group can benefit from rotating or collective loans. It is based on mutual trust and solidarity. Hopefund Burundi supports groups with training and regular monitoring.
faq.q5: Can I use Hopefund Burundi without a smartphone?
faq.a5: Absolutely! Our USSD service (*847#) works on all phones, even basic ones. You can check your balance, make transfers and pay bills. Our branches are also there to welcome you in person.
